intro: Neonauclea longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-peduncle nauclea, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated inflorescences that bear small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, smooth, spherical fruits. Neonauclea longipedunculata is native to parts of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
